ygData.subject: Re: [EverQuest] Digest Number 621
ygData.msgSnippet: I agree.  Great concept but not willing to pay for it.   On the other hand, depending on the fee for the service it could be just as easily thought of like
ygData.messageBody:
I agree.  Great concept but not willing to pay for it.   On the other hand, depending on the fee for the service it could be just as easily thought of like this:
 
Let's hypothetically say EQ comes with the EQIM already on the CD.  It's an added option to install.  Let's say you decide to install it.  Then you're agreeing that rather than $12.95/mo for just EverQuest, you pay $13.95 (or whatever) for EverQuest AND EQIM.  If you do not decide to install it then you're just paying the $12.95 as usual.  And since foresight tells me this is probably what they will end up doing in the long run, I don't see the difference then having to pay for it now or just having the cost included when you subscribe to EQ let's say 6 months down the road.  If you're gonna use, they're gonna get your money one way or another... besides... bandwidth costs... and 400,000+ people playing the game simultaneously AND now EQIM...  that's gonna be a lot of traffic.  Better start opening your wallets....
 
Wulfric
32 rogue
Cazic Thule
 
 
----- Original Message -----
From: Y2kansas
To: EverQuest@yahoogroups.com
Sent: Saturday, November 02, 2002 4:26 PM
Subject: Re: [EverQuest] Digest Number 621

Yeah, too bad they're gonna charge to use this. It's a great idea, just not
a good enough one for me to justify forking over more money for a game when
money's tight already.

Y2Kansas

Damasciss Kyndhardt - 36 Druid - E'ci
